title: Review Steering Document: tech.md
description:
Requesting approval for **tech.md** steering document (P-3 prerequisite, 2 of 3):

**Document Overview:**
- **Length**: ~400 lines
- **Purpose**: Complete technology stack and technical architecture for Assignment 7

**Key Content:**

1. **Core Technologies**
   - Language: C++20 with MSVC (Visual Studio 2022)
   - Platform: Windows x64 only (DirectX 11 dependency)
   - Compiler Flags: `/std:c++20`, `/W3`, `/permissive-`

2. **Key Dependencies**
   - DirectX 11: GPU rendering, vertex/index buffers, shaders, textures
   - FMOD Studio API: Professional audio middleware
   - Winsock2: TCP/UDP networking, WebSocket client
   - nlohmann/json: Header-only JSON parsing (`Engine\Code\ThirdParty\json\json.hpp`)
   - KADI Broker: WebSocket message broker for AI-game communication

3. **Application Architecture**
   - **Multi-Threaded Chunk-Based World Engine**: Main thread + (N-1) worker threads
   - **Entity-Component System**: Physics-enabled objects (Player, AIAgent, ItemEntity)
   - **Registry Pattern (Assignment 7)**: Generic `Registry<T>` for type-safe ID management

4. **KADI WebSocket Integration**
   - Protocol: WebSocket (RFC 6455) with KADI protocol v1
   - Authentication: Public/private key pairs (RSA-based)
   - Message Format: JSON-RPC 2.0 for tool invocation
   - **MCP Tools (PascalCase_With_Underscores):**
     * `SimpleMiner_Spawn_Agent(name, x, y, z)`
     * `SimpleMiner_Move_Agent(agentID, dirX, dirY, dirZ, duration)`
     * `SimpleMiner_Mine_Block(agentID, x, y, z)`
     * `SimpleMiner_Place_Block(agentID, blockType, x, y, z)`
     * `SimpleMiner_Get_Agent_Vision(agentID)`
     * `SimpleMiner_Get_Agent_Inventory(agentID)`
     * `SimpleMiner_Craft_Item(agentID, recipeID)`

5. **Technical Decisions with Rationale**
   - **JSON Over XML**: User explicitly requested (3 comments), Engine has nlohmann/json, KADI consistency
   - **KADI WebSocket Over Direct API**: Standard protocol, remote agents, user has DigitalOcean deployment
   - **Use Existing WidgetSubsystem**: Time constraint (due 12/12), functional core, defer redesign to post-A7
   - **Command Queue Over Goal-Based AI**: KISS principle, user stated "command execution for now"
   - **2×2 Crafting Grid Only**: YAGNI principle, sufficient for 10 MVP recipes

6. **Known Limitations & Technical Debt**
   - WidgetSubsystem alpha quality (missing modal dialogs, input routing, layouts)
   - Single-threaded game logic (10+ agents may cause frame drops)
   - No network multiplayer (no client-server architecture)
   - KADI broker external dependency (separate process required)
   - Windows-only DirectX 11 (no cross-platform support)

7. **Performance Requirements**
   - Target FPS: 60 FPS sustained with inventory UI open and 3-10 AI agents
   - UI Rendering: < 2ms per frame for all widgets
   - Agent Update: < 0.5ms per agent per frame
   - JSON Loading: < 100ms for all registries at startup

**Alignment with Requirements:**
- Documents all technology choices with clear rationale
- MCP tool naming: PascalCase_With_Underscores per user request
- Technical debt openly acknowledged
- Performance targets clearly defined

**Next Steps After Approval:**
- Review structure.md (code organization)
- After all three approved, P-3 complete → proceed to design.md
